company_profile.name: FlowBoard
company_profile.description: FlowBoard is an AI-powered project management platform built for distributed engineering teams. We replace the chaos of Slack threads, scattered docs, and missed deadlines with a single command center that auto-prioritizes work, surfaces blockers before standup, and generates sprint reports in one click.

facts.label: Core Feature
facts.value: AI-powered sprint auto-planning that learns from team velocity

facts.label: Differentiator
facts.value: Real-time blocker detection using commit + PR + Slack signal fusion

facts.label: Market Size
facts.value: Project management software market is $7.2B in 2025, growing 13% CAGR

facts.label: Primary Buyer
facts.value: VP of Engineering at 50-500 person companies with 3+ remote offices

facts.label: Weakness of Asana
facts.value: Asana lacks native AI sprint planning and requires heavy manual configuration

facts.label: Weakness of Monday
facts.value: Monday.com is perceived as too visual/marketing-oriented for serious engineering teams

facts.label: Pricing Model
facts.value: Per-seat SaaS, $15/user/month for teams, $29/user/month for enterprise

facts.label: Current ARR
facts.value: $1.2M ARR with 85 paying teams, 40% MoM growth

facts.label: Churn Insight
facts.value: Teams that activate AI sprint planning in week 1 have 3x lower churn

facts.label: Brand Perception
facts.value: Seen as the technical PM tool — engineers recommend it to their managers

icps.name: Engineering Leader

psychographics.beliefs: Believes engineering productivity is the #1 lever for company growth
psychographics.identity: Technical leader who ships, not a process bureaucrat
psychographics.fears: Losing top engineers to burnout or better-tooled competitors
triggers: missed sprint commitments 3x in a row
board asks for eng velocity metrics

painPoints: Sprint planning takes 4+ hours per week across the org
No visibility into cross-team dependencies until things break
Reporting to the board requires manual spreadsheet assembly
goals: Get real-time visibility into blockers before standup
objections: We already use Jira — switching cost is too high
AI planning sounds cool but can it really understand our codebase context?
My team will resist another tool

icps.name: VP of Operations

psychographics.beliefs: Cross-functional visibility is the key to scaling without chaos
psychographics.identity: The person who makes the machine run smoothly
psychographics.fears: Being blindsided by project delays that impact revenue
triggers: major project delay impacts a customer commitment
CEO asks why engineering is slow

painPoints: Engineering is a black box — no idea what's on track vs at risk
Status updates are stale by the time they reach leadership
Resource allocation across projects is guesswork
goals: Real-time project health dashboard for leadership
objections: Engineering already has their tools — why do I need another view?
Will engineers actually keep this updated?
How is this different from a BI dashboard on top of Jira?

positioning.uvp: FlowBoard is the only project management platform that uses real-time engineering signals — commits, PRs, Slack, and CI/CD — to auto-plan sprints, detect blockers before standup, and generate board-ready reports without any manual input.
differentiators: Signal fusion: combines code, chat, and CI data for true engineering intelligence
Zero-config AI sprint planning that learns from your team's actual velocity
Board-ready reports generated automatically — no spreadsheet assembly
Built by engineers for engineers — not a repurposed marketing PM tool

messaging.oneLiner: FlowBoard: AI-powered project management that thinks like an engineer.
messaging.positioningStatement: For engineering leaders at scaling companies who are drowning in manual sprint planning and blind to cross-team blockers, FlowBoard is the AI-native project management platform that auto-plans sprints, detects blockers in real-time, and generates board-ready reports — unlike Asana or Monday which require hours of manual configuration and have zero engineering intelligence.

valueProps.title: AI Sprint Auto-Planning
valueProps.description: Our AI learns your team's velocity and auto-generates sprint plans that actually match capacity.

valueProps.title: Real-Time Blocker Detection
valueProps.description: Fuses signals from code, chat, and CI to surface blockers before your morning standup.

valueProps.title: One-Click Board Reports
valueProps.description: Auto-generates investor and board-ready engineering metrics without touching a spreadsheet.

doList: Show don't tell — use product screenshots
dontList: Don't use corporate buzzwords like 'synergy' or 'leverage'
Don't oversimplify — our audience is technical
Don't bash competitors by name in public content

soundbites: Stop planning sprints. Start shipping them.
Your standup should surface surprises, not create them.
Board decks shouldn't take longer than the sprint itself.
guardrails: Never claim we replace engineers — we amplify them
Always ground claims in data or customer quotes
Avoid 'AI' as a standalone selling point — show the specific outcome
